intro: Hordeum patulum, commonly known as the slender barley or the narrow-leaved barley, is a species of grass native to the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with both male and female flowers, typical of the Poaceae family. Hordeum patulum is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It plays a minor role in ecological systems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and genetic traits.
